qas.question: What percentage range of uranium oxide is usually contained in low-grade uranium ore?
Along with underground, open pit and in-situ leaching, what sort of mining is used to mine uranium?
In what country are high-grade uranium ores notably found?
In what province of Canada is the Athabasca Basin?
What is the average percentage of uranium oxide contained in the ores mined in the Athabasca Basin?
What percentage range of uranium dioxide is usually contained in low-grade uranium ore?
Along with underground, open pit and in-situ leaching, what sort of mining is used to expel uranium?
In what country are high-grade uranium ores not found?
In what state of Canada is the Athabasca Basin?
What is the average percentage of uranium dioxide contained in the ores mined in the Athabasca Basin?

context: Uranium ore is mined in several ways: by open pit, underground, in-situ leaching, and <a1_0><b6_0>borehole<b6_0/><a1_0/> mining (see uranium mining). Low-grade uranium ore mined typically contains <a0_0><b5_0>0.01 to 0.25%<b5_0/><a0_0/> uranium oxides. Extensive measures must be employed to extract the metal from its ore. High-grade ores found in Athabasca Basin deposits in <a3_0><b8_0>Saskatchewan<b8_0/><a3_0/>, <a2_0><b7_0>Canada<b7_0/><a2_0/> can contain up to <a4_0><b9_0>23%<b9_0/><a4_0/> uranium oxides on average. Uranium ore is crushed and rendered into a fine powder and then leached with either an acid or alkali. The leachate is subjected to one of several sequences of precipitation, solvent extraction, and ion exchange. The resulting mixture, called yellowcake, contains at least 75% uranium oxides U3O8. Yellowcake is then calcined to remove impurities from the milling process before refining and conversion.
